9.3. STATUS OF WOMEN IN INDIAN POLITICS: Voting percentage for women have increased in assembly polls besides their participation as candidates and the possibilities of their victory are substantially low. Irom Sharmila and Najima in Manipur, in the absence of funds, they are campaigning for elections on bicycles. Most of the ‗winnable‘ women candidates come from political families. Many women who are made to file nominations from certain constituencies cannot even retain their deposits. India ranks 103rd in the Women in Parliament study. In the Lok Sabha, out of the 543 members, only 79 are women. In the Rajya Sabha, there are only 29 female MPs among 243 members. List of elected Women in Lok Sabha
